title: Lab 8: Geospatial visualizations
description: In this lab, we will be building an immersive, interactive map visualization of bike traffic in the Boston area during different times of the day, shown in the screencast above

title: A4: Persuasive or Deceptive Visualization?
description: A burning truth, Rising global surface temperatures are plotted for each year, dating back to 1960. The temperature has risen over 1.5 degrees over the past 40 years, with no stop in sight. Climate-related disasters are noted along different dates in the figure.

title: A3: Visualization Design
description: The above figure compares the census data from 1900 and 2000 in order to answer whether there is a skew towards which sex has a longer life expectancy. The graphic is title Do women really live longer?. The census data from 1900 shows no particular skew, while the census data from 2000 shows that there are more reported women ages 70 and up compared to men.

title: A2: Exploratory Data Analysis
description: What surprised me the most about the articles were the number of flips that occured in the Boston area. However, there have been many flips (as per the definition of the dataset) that have occured over the last 23 years in the Boston area. This is shown geographically in the above figure with all transacations in the Boston area marked in either blue (a flip) or red (other). A large number of flips have occured in Backbay, downtown, and North end --- all expensive zip codes.
